page.title: 17History of St.Paul's Church
page.content: Choppington was part of the Parish of Bedlington until 1866 when St.Paul's came into being. The Parish of St.Paul's covers Choppington, Guidepost, Stakeford, and part of Bomarsund. The church probably came into being with the opening of the mines and the resulting rise in local population. Nowadays there are reminders of the mines within the church. The brass processional was bought in memory of all the miners who lost their lives in the mines at Choppington. Many miners are buried in St. Paul's churchyard. Glebe Terrace which is opposite St. Paul's, once belonged to the church. The houses were built on land owned by the church- known as a glebe- and so rent for them had to be paid to the Parish. The houses are now privately owned.
